alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 02 at 5:31PM CST until January 02 at 6:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Craig County in northeastern Oklahoma... West central Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northern Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 615 PM CST. * At 530 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Pryor, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Langley... Adair... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Disney... Big Cabin... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Cherokee State Park... Spavinaw State Park... Cleora... Chloeta... Strang... Disney Little Blue State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 269 and 289. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
